title: File upload via drag-and-drop with multiple files
description: Verify that users can successfully upload multiple files using drag-and-drop functionality and the files appear correctly for sharing.

steps.description: Navigate to the FilePizza upload page
Drag and drop multiple files onto the designated upload area
Verify all dropped files are listed as ready for upload
Verify the upload session generates a shareable link and QR code

title: File upload via file picker with multiple files
description: Ensure users can select multiple files using the file picker and that these files are prepared correctly for the upload session.

steps.description: Navigate to the FilePizza upload page
Click the file picker button and select multiple files
Confirm the selected files appear in the upload list
Validate shareable link and QR code are generated for the session

title: Peer-to-peer file download via WebRTC connection
description: Verify that recipients can use the generated link or QR code to connect directly to the uploader's browser and download files without server storage.

steps.description: Open a recipient browser and navigate to the shared link
Verify the recipient connects successfully to the uploader via WebRTC
Start the file download
Confirm files download completely and correctly to the recipient device

title: Optional password protection restricts unauthorized access
description: Test that when a password is set on the upload session, only authorized users entering the correct password can download the files.

steps.description: Uploader creates an upload session and sets a password
Recipient opens the shared link and attempts to connect without entering a password
Verify access is denied and password prompt is shown
Recipient enters an incorrect password and tries to connect
Verify access is still denied
Recipient enters the correct password and connects
Verify download starts and completes successfully

title: Progress bars accurately reflect upload and download status
description: Ensure the progress tracking bars for both uploaders and downloaders update in real-time and correctly show transfer completion.

steps.description: Start uploading multiple files from the uploader side
Verify the upload progress bar increments smoothly and reaches 100% on completion
Start file download on the recipient side
Confirm the download progress bar matches the actual download progress and ends at 100%

title: Handling of large files with multi-file zipped download
description: Verify that when multiple large files are uploaded, the recipient downloads them as a zip archive and no data loss occurs.

steps.description: Uploader uploads multiple large files (e.g., >100MB total)
Shareable link and QR code are generated without error
Recipient connects and downloads the files
Verify files are delivered as a zipped archive
Confirm the archive can be extracted without errors and all files are intact

title: WebRTC connection management and error recovery
description: Test WebRTC signaling, TURN/STUN servers usage, and the app's ability to handle connection failures gracefully with retry and cancel options.

steps.description: Start a file transfer session between uploader and recipient
Simulate network interruption to break the WebRTC connection
Verify that the app detects the connection failure and shows retry and cancel options
Choose retry and verify if the connection attempts to re-establish
Confirm that the connection recovers successfully and transfer resumes
Simulate another failure and select cancel
Ensure the transfer is cancelled cleanly and UI updates accordingly

title: Theme toggle switches between dark and light modes seamlessly
description: Validate the theme toggle changes UI between dark and light themes on both desktop and mobile and that styling updates correctly without glitches.

steps.description: Open the app and locate the theme toggle control
Toggle to dark mode
Verify UI colors and backgrounds update to dark theme styles
Toggle back to light mode
Verify UI reverts correctly to light theme design
Repeat tests on mobile browser and validate consistent theme switching

title: Terms acceptance required before enabling file transfers
description: Check the terms of use acceptance workflow and ensure that users cannot start uploads or downloads without accepting terms.

steps.description: Navigate to the app homepage without accepting terms yet
Verify that upload or download functionality is disabled or blocked
Accept the terms of service prompt
Confirm upload and download features become enabled
Try to report a violation before accepting terms and verify it is blocked

title: Violation reporting mechanism works correctly
description: Verify that users can report terms of service violations and the reports are submitted properly through the app.

steps.description: Accept terms and start file transfer session
Use the report violation button to submit a report
Confirm report submission completes without error
Verify user is notified of successful report

title: API endpoint load and response validation
description: Test the backend API routes for channel creation, ice event handling, renewal, and destruction under normal and load conditions.

steps.description: Send valid requests to the channel creation API endpoint
Verify the creation response returns correct channel data
Send ICE candidate data to the ice route
Confirm successful receipt and processing with no errors
Send renewal request on an active channel
Verify the channel expiry is properly extended
Send destruction request to terminate a channel
Confirm channel is removed and subsequent connections are rejected
Perform a load test by sending multiple concurrent requests to all API routes
Verify API remains responsive and consistent under load

title: Aurora animated background renders smoothly
description: Ensure the Aurora background animation displays without perceptible frame drops or UI performance degradation on supported browsers.

steps.description: Load the app on desktop and mobile browsers
Observe the Aurora animation for smoothness and absence of flickering or freezing
Confirm the animation does not interfere with the usability or responsiveness of UI components

title: Service Workers and Web Streams API support for streaming downloads
description: Verify that file downloads utilize streaming via Web Streams API and service workers, enabling progressive data reception without loading whole file into memory.

steps.description: Start a file download from the recipient side
Check that data is received progressively using streams APIs
Ensure service workers are active and intercepting relevant network requests
Confirm file fully downloads and can be opened without corruption

title: UI components follow glassmorphism design and are reusable
description: Validate that all reusable UI components use glassmorphism styling, appear consistent, and behave as expected across different app sections.

steps.description: Navigate through upload, download, and settings pages
Verify buttons, inputs, progress bars, modals, and backgrounds maintain glassmorphism styling
Check components respond appropriately to user interactions (clicks, focus, hover)

title: Handling edge case: uploading zero files
description: Check that initiating an upload without selecting or dropping any files shows an appropriate error or disables upload action.

steps.description: Navigate to upload page
Attempt to start upload without selecting any files
Verify upload action is disabled or error message prompts user to select files

title: Edge case: download link or QR code is invalid or expired
description: Test app behavior when a recipient tries to connect using an invalid, corrupted, or expired share link or QR code.

steps.description: Modify a valid shareable link to an invalid or expired state
Open the invalid link or scan the corrupted QR code on recipient device
Verify the app shows an appropriate error message indicating session is invalid or expired
Ensure no WebRTC connection is established

title: Cancel ongoing file transfer from uploader side
description: Verify the uploader can cancel an active file transfer session, and the recipient is notified of the cancellation.

steps.description: Start uploading files and sharing link
Recipient begins downloading files
Uploader clicks cancel transfer button during active transfer
Confirm that transfer stops immediately
Recipient receives notification that transfer was cancelled

title: Verify message protocol encoding/decoding correctness in WebRTC communication
description: Ensure all WebRTC messages sent over data channels are correctly encoded and decoded matching the protocol, without data corruption.

steps.description: Initiate uploader and downloader WebRTC connection
Send various control and data messages following the app's message protocol
Verify messages are parsed correctly on recipient side without errors
Ensure corrupted or malformed messages are handled gracefully
